TopicTitle: Displaying a window in the RnD interface

Articles.Content:
Here's a shot of something from stock that I'd like to do:

![pySheAx.png](http://i.imgur.com/pySheAx.png)

I'm trying to call a window when a tech is researched. I can get the code to display basic text, but nothing else. It just seems to ignore the window call.

    [KSPAddon(KSPAddon.Startup.EveryScene, false)]public class TestingMain : MonoBehaviourRect windowRect = new Rect(400, 0, 150, 150);public void Start(){          	GameEvents.OnTechnologyResearched.Add(DrawWind);}public void DrawCall(GameEvents.HostTargetAction ev){	//ScreenMessages.PostScreenMessage("KHAAAAAAN!!!", 4.0f, ScreenMessageStyle.UPPER_LEFT);	windowRect = GUILayout.Window(50, windowRect, DrawWindow, "Steeeeve", HighLogic.Skin.window);}void DrawWindow(Int32 id){	GUILayout.BeginVertical();	GUILayout.Label("HEy-ooo!");	GUILayout.EndVertical();}

When I uncomment the ScreenMessages line and comment out the window call, it displays the text when a tech is researched just fine. The problem is that I'd like to interrupt the process with an additional dialog box.

That window is only going to display for a single frame (or maybe not even that since the event probably doesn't count as a GUI function). You need to set a flag in the event handler and display your window based on the flag state

EDIT

Don't know if you can interrupt the stock window.
